intro: Comesperma linariifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional Aboriginal medicine. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological significance in its native habitat.
